opts

But how much is ? 🤯

Check my back of the envelope calculations and - if you want to - make them your own by dragging numbers ↔️

In National Childrens Hospitals❓

  • National Childrens Hospitals 👧🏻

In bike sheds❓

  • bike sheds 🚴
  • Using x 🚴 per shed, these can store bikes 🚴

In one-off gifts❓

  • x gifts for each person in Ireland 🎁

In houses❓

  • Fully funded: of them 🏡
  • Using an average occupancy of people: enough on it's own to house of a population

In Oasis tickets❓

  • tickets each for every person in Ireland! 💃🕺
  • Oasis might need to play gigs together in Croke Park at capacity, to honor this volume of tickets 🎶🧑‍🤝‍🧑🎶

In heat pump grants❓

  • x heat pump grants 🔥

It's a lot of money! 💰

But for other context, this is of Ireland's total expenditure in 2023, and of Ireland's national debt.

🤷

These back-of-the-envelope calculations are made using calculang: a language for calculations for structure, flexibility and communication about numbers.

You can check (and change!) their formulas under the tab for '💬' (top left)

"Scrubbable numbers" as an interaction technique for models - inside narrative text, is something championed by Bret Victor. I recommend his other work: especially the Model-driven debate section of his climate essay, to find further neat interactions with models and their calculations.

This was a little, hurried exercise by Declan. Please don't use these numbers for decision making ⚠️🙂

CalcWithDec.dev
